tool_description: PlantLink is a soil moisture sensors for home gardeners. Purchase one from www.myplantlink.com and we can help you water your plants. This api details the methods to access and manipulate data and settings for the PlantLink application.
name: PlantLink
title: PlantLink

api_list.name: List Notifications

optional_parameters.name: mark_read
optional_parameters.description: This query string parameter determines whether all the

api_list.name: List Plant Types
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://plantlink.p.rapidapi.com/plantTypes"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "plantlink.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://plantlink.p.rapidapi.com/plantTypes"

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Basestation
api_list.description: serial can actually be empty as long as basestation_id is set

required_parameters.name: serial
required_parameters.description: the serial code of the base station

api_list.name: Get Plant

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: The unique id of the plant to fetch

api_list.code:

url = "https://plantlink.p.rapidapi.com/plants/241097"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "plantlink.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

import requests

url = "https://plantlink.p.rapidapi.com/plants/{id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "plantlink.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Link

required_parameters.name: serial
required_parameters.description: the serial code of the link

optional_parameters.name: link_id
optional_parameters.description: the id of the link that can be used if the serial of get link is empty

api_list.name: List Measurements

required_parameters.name: plant_id
required_parameters.description: the id of the plant that will own all the returned measurements

optional_parameters.name: start_datetime
optional_parameters.description: the unix utc timestamp that sets the start of the time range for which to fetch measurements

optional_parameters.name: end_datetime
optional_parameters.description: the unix utc timestamp that sets the end of the time range for which to fetch measurements. Assumes to current if not present

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The number of data points to fetch, expected to be relatively evenly spaced over the given time range

optional_parameters.name: query_format
optional_parameters.description: The format of the data to be returned csv for csv and json for json. Defaults to json if parameter not listed

api_list.name: SMS Confirmation
api_list.description:
This endpoint is used to confirm the owner of sms numbers. The sms user is sent a text with a url
            to this endpoint with a temporary and unique key given the sms number. If a hit is registered to this
            endpoint the sms number is considered confirmed.

required_parameters.name: confirmation_key
required_parameters.description: A hashed temporary key used to uniquely identify which sms user is being confirmed

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://plantlink.p.rapidapi.com/sms-confirmation/1245656095ae"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "plantlink.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://plantlink.p.rapidapi.com/sms-confirmation/{confirmation_key}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "plantlink.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
